content: Come up with the best playing 11 for Indian cricket team for the cricket world cup going to be held in 2023 in India. It is the ODI format that is 50 overs format. Keep in mind that the pitches in India are generally conducive to spin bowling and are also typically high scoring grounds where a brisk start in the beginning of the innings is going to be crucial. Also keep in mind that the team needs to have a good balance of right handed and left handed batsman. Exclude Shikhar Dhawan, Bhuvaneshwar Kumar and Rishab Pant from the playing 11.
